appearances.snippet: his death was confirmed early this morning by house majority whip tom emmer and national republican congressional committee chair richard hudson lamalfa was first elected to congress back in 2012 serving nearly 15 years on capitol hill. he later became chair of the congressional western caucus and served on several key committees that included agriculture, natural resources, transportation and infrastructure. governor gavin newsom putting out a statement this morning over acts saying, quote, while we often approached issues from different perspectives, he fought every day for the people of california with conviction and care. he will be deeply missed, unquote. his death also has implications for control of the house. republicans now hold 18 seats compared to 213 for democrats, meaning house leaders can afford no more than 2 republican defections on any party line vote. assuming all members are present and voting. governor newsom will call a special election to replace him which could happen as late as june. that's when california will hold its primary for the 2026 midterm. james. >> michael, than
